content:
Viewport3DVisual Class

Definition

Renders the Visual3D children within the specified 2D viewport bounds.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("Children")]
public sealed class Viewport3DVisual : System.Windows.Media.Visual

Remarks

The Viewport3DVisual is a 2D Visual with 3D children. The Viewport3DVisual provides necessary infrastructure for the Viewport3D element. Most users will want to use the Viewport3D element.

Constructors

Viewport3DVisual()

Initializes a new instance of the Viewport3DVisual class.

public Viewport3DVisual ();

Fields

CameraProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual.Camera* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty CameraProperty;

ViewportProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual.Viewport* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty ViewportProperty;

Properties

BitmapEffect

Gets or sets the BitmapEffect applied to the Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffect BitmapEffect { get; set; }
Value
BitmapEffect

BitmapEffect applied to the Viewport3DVisual.

Remarks

Bitmap effects are software-rendered. Any object that applies an effect will also be rendered in software. Bitmap effects should not be applied to large visuals or animations as this can degrade performance.

BitmapEffectInput

Gets or sets the BitmapEffectInput applied to the Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffectInput BitmapEffectInput { get; set; }
Value
BitmapEffectInput

BitmapEffectInput applied to the Viewport3DVisual.

Remarks

BitmapEffectInput applies the BitmapEffect given in the BitmapEffect property to a specified region of the visual object.

Bitmap effects are software-rendered. Any object that applies an effect will also be rendered in software. Bitmap effects should not be applied to large visuals or animations as this can degrade performance.

Camera

Gets or sets the Camera used by the Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Camera Camera { get; set; }
Value
Camera

Camera used by the Viewport3DVisual.

Children

Gets a collection of Visual3D objects contained by Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3DCollection Children { get; }
Value
Visual3DCollection

Collection of the objects contained by the Viewport3DVisual.

Clip

Gets or sets the clipping region of the Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.Media.Geometry Clip { get; set; }
Value
Geometry

Geometry that defines the clipping area.

ContentBounds

Gets the bounding box for the contents of the Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.Rect ContentBounds { get; }
Value
Rect

Rect that defines the bounding box.

DescendantBounds

Gets the union of all of the content bounding boxes for all of the descendants of the Viewport3DVisual, but not including the contents of the Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.Rect DescendantBounds { get; }
Value
Rect

Rect that defines the union.

Offset

Gets or sets the offset value of the Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.Vector Offset { get; set; }
Value
Vector

Vector that represents the offset value of the Viewport3DVisual.

Opacity

Gets or sets the opacity of the Viewport3DVisual.

public double Opacity { get; set; }
Value
Double

The value of the Opacity property is expressed as a value between 0 and 1, specifying a range from fully transparent to fully opaque. A value of 0 indicates that the Opacity is completely transparent, while a value of 1 indicates that the Opacity is completely opaque. A value 0.5 would indicate the Opacity is 50% opaque, a value of 0.725 would indicate the Opacity is 72.5% opaque, and so on. Values less than 0 are treated as 0, while values greater than 1 are treated as 1.

OpacityMask

Gets or sets the opacity mask value of the Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.Media.Brush OpacityMask { get; set; }
Value
Brush

Brush that represents the opacity mask value of the Viewport3DVisual.

Parent

Gets the parent Visual for the Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.DependencyObject Parent { get; }
Value
DependencyObject

Visual parent of the Viewport3DVisual.

Transform

Gets or sets the transform value of the Viewport3DVisual.

public System.Windows.Media.Transform Transform { get; set; }
Value
Transform

Transform applied to the Viewport3DVisual.

Viewport

Gets or sets the rectangle in which the Viewport3DVisual will be rendered.

public System.Windows.Rect Viewport { get; set; }
Value
Rect

Rectangle in which the contents of the Viewport3D will be rendered.

HitTest(Point)

Returns the top-most visual object of a hit test performed at a specified Point.

public System.Windows.Media.HitTestResult HitTest (System.Windows.Point point);

Point

Point against which to hit test.

Returns

The hit test result of the visual returned as a HitTestResult type.

HitTest(HitTestFilterCallback,HitTestResultCallback,HitTestParameters)

Initiate a hit test on the Viewport3DVisual by using the HitTestFilterCallback and HitTestResultCallback objects.

public void HitTest (System.Windows.Media.HitTestFilterCallback filterCallback, System.Windows.Media.HitTestResultCallback resultCallback, System.Windows.Media.HitTestParameters hitTestParameters);
filterCallback
HitTestFilterCallback

Value of type HitTestFilterCallback.

resultCallback
HitTestResultCallback

Value of type HitTestResultCallback.

hitTestParameters
HitTestParameters

Value of type HitTestParameters.

Remarks

The filterCallback parameter can be null, in which case, it is ignored. If filterCallback is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), it is invoked before resultCallback.

protected override System.Windows.Media.GeometryHitTestResult HitTestCore (System.Windows.Media.GeometryHitTestParameters hitTestParameters);

Returns
